value.0: I am Master Sabah yn Saladin el Sultan, second in clarity only to the Grandmaster himself. You will address me with your questions.

You come to me with clouded understanding and thus you are not strong. Over the course of my training you will learn clarity and gain strength you have never known. Some of the witless dogs who occupied this sacred place still persist in the woods nearby, and you will either learn from their mistakes or they will learn from yours.

*Master Sabah leads you out into the bitter cold of the forest in search of the displaced assassins who used to call the Monastery home. Using the freezing whiteout for cover the two of you manage to sneak up upon a small, miserable encampment of cutthroats.*

*The Frozen Hand Master engages immediately, and you observe him making very precise strikes with his fingertips that dent armor and leave the unfortunate targets paralyzed from the neck down, often falling over into the snow from lack of balance.*

*Your attention shifts suddenly as one of the assassins lunges at you. You attempt to emulate Master Sabah's technique, but your fingers fail to penetrate enough armor to deliver a paralyzing blow. It takes nearly a minute for you to best your opponent, and by that time, Master Sabah has finished off the rest of the camp. The two of you return in silence to the Monastery.* <StartAction>[You fail to learn the Freeze Lifeblood technique]</Start>

*Your attention shifts suddenly as one of the assassins lunges at you. You attempt to emulate Master Sabah's technique and are rewarded by a groan of pain from your now frozen opponent. Dispatching the helpless rogue quickly, you shift your attention to those few remaining, and Master Sabah disengages to watch your progress. You finish the rest quickly thanks to your new maneuver, and the two of you return in silence to the Monastery.*  <StartAction>[You learn the Freeze Lifeblood technique]</Start>
I can see clearly that you have learned this lesson well, ascetic.
*The Master of the Frozen Hand leads you deep into the forest. The two of you spy a mighty troll feasting on the entrails of a great mountain cat, and your mentor bids you to observe closely.*

*Sabah closes the distance before the ugly giant can even stand upright and lands a powerful blow on the creature's free arm. It bellows and tries to use it to no avail, the limb practically dead weight, and when it tries to switch arms by dropping its meal the Master deadens that one as well.*

*He invites you to take his place, and moves away to observe as the troll's inherent regeneration heals its arms back to full strength. You try to replicate what you observed, but your technique is sloppy and far too slow to avoid the savage counterattack. Sabah watches impassively as you struggle to kill the creature to save your own life, and he says nothing as the two of you return to the Monastery.* <StartAction>[You fail to learn the Weakening Touch technique]</Start>

*He invites you to take his place, and moves away to observe as the troll's inherent regeneration heals its arms back to full strength. Dodging nimbly inside its reach you hammer its arms and legs with the same maneuver, driving it to the ground. Sabah nods approvingly as you strike one last time and drive the beast into the snow before the two of you return to the Monastery.* <StartAction>[You learn the Weakening Touch technique]</Start>
I can see clearly that you have learned this lesson well, ascetic.

You are standing in the Chamber of Immaculate Clarity, the heart of the Monastery of the Frozen Hand. Within these walls we contemplate the Unclouded Way and practice a form of asceticism focused upon the Frostmaiden's unbridled purity as a standard for all that we are.
Ask your questions, aspirant.

We venerate Her, but She gives us nothing. In truth, we need nothing more than Her example to live by, and it is by Her unspoken teachings that we persist. The freezing cold is our bread and water, and we are its disciples.

As ice is purified, it becomes stronger. So too do we purify ourselves in the cold of both body and mind, and become unyielding as the bitter frost. As ice strengthens, it becomes clear. So too do we achieve enlightenment, seeing the world through eyes unclouded and unflinching. When the Great Winter comes we will be ready, having learned Her lessons well, and we will survive to watch Her dance on Faer√ªn's frozen soul.

This temple was once a haven for simple thieves and assassins, but it has been reclaimed after those mongrels were fool enough to slay a Postulant of the Aurilite church. You may find their bodies still fleeing in the woods from the Grandmaster's wrath, and there they will remain, frozen for all time.
Apologies, master, I do not wish to disturb you. <StartAction>[Leave]</Start>
Master Sabah, I wish to learn the Way of the Frozen Hand. What must I do?
None, at the moment.
I wish to learn how to strike the heart with the chill of death. <StartAction>[Begin Freeze Lifeblood training]</Start>
[Continue]
[Continue]
I wish to learn how to numb muscles and thus sap their strength. <StartAction>[Begin Weakening Touch training]</Start>
[Continue]
[Continue]
I wish to ask you about something else.
What is this place?
I see. I have more questions.
I wish to ask you about something else.
Are you servants of Auril?
I wish to ask you about something else.
What is the Unclouded Way?
I wish to ask you about something else.
How did the Frozen Hand come to be here?
I wish to ask you about something else.
